CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 30, 1949, pg. 1, reads: "King Cole Signs - Nat (King) Cole is pictured signing legal papers in his $25,000 damage suit against the Hotel Mayfair as, left to right, Attorneys Paul F. Jones and Thomas E. Barton, and Mrs. Cole look on. The Coles were refused rooms in downtown hotel early Monday morning, the suit avers. - Harris Photo."Cutline for image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, National edition, May 7, 1949, pg. 1, reads: "Nat (King) Cole Sues Hotel - Denied Rooms - Noted Singer Sues Hotel In Pittsburgh - Nat (King) Cole (right, top photo), signs legal papers in his $25,000 damage suit against Mayfair Hotel (bottom photo) in Pittsburgh, Pa., as his wife (center) and attorneys, Paul F. Jones (left) and Thomas E. Barton look on. - Harris Photos."  Portion of accompanying article reads: "Nat (King) Cole filed a $25,000 damage suit against the Hotel Mayfair here last Thursday.  The first civil suit filed in Pittsburgh in forty years grew out of charges that the nationally famous musician and his wife were refused rooms at the hotel April 25, after two white members of the Cole entourage had received accommodations..."
TitMainTitle: Nat King Cole and his wife Maria Cole, signing papers for racial discrimination lawsuit against Mayfair Hotel in Pittsburgh, with Atty. Paul F. Jones on left, and Atty. Thomas E. Barton, in Jones' office
